interp2d.pro

00001 ;+
00002 ; NAME:
00003 ;   interp2d
00004 ; PURPOSE:
00005 ;   Perform bilinear 2d interpolation using the IDL intrinsic 
00006 ;   interpolate procedure
00007 ; CALLING SEQUENCE:
00008 ;   result = interp2d(A,x0,y0,x1,y1)
00009 ;   result = interp2d(A,x0,y0,x1,y1,/grid)
00010 ;   result = interp2d(A,x0,y0,x1,y1,/regular,/cubic)
00011 ;   result = interp2d(A,x0,y0,x1,y1,missing=missing)
00012 ; INPUTS:
00013 ;   A   = 2d array to interpolate
00014 ;   x0  = Values that correspond to A(0,0), A(1,0), ...
00015 ;   y0  = Values that correspond to A(0,0), A(0,1), ...
00016 ;   x1  = New X values at which A should be interpolated
00017 ;   y1  = New Y values at which A should be interpolated
00018 ; OPTIONAL INPUTS:
00019 ;   nxny = [nx,ny] Vector of length 2 which specifies the size of
00020 ;         the regular linearized grid produced with trigrid.  The
00021 ;         default is nxny = [51,51].  If the size of A is much larger
00022 ;     than 51 by 51, greater accuracy may be obtained by having
00023 ;         nxny = [n_elements(A(*,0),n_elements(A(0,*))]
00024 ; OPTIONAL INPUT KEYWORDS:
00025 ;   grid= If set, return an n_elements(X1) by n_elements(y1) grid
00026 ;   missing = Value to points which have X1 gt max(X0) or X1 lt min(X0)
00027 ;       and the same for Y1.
00028 ;   quintic = If set, use smooth interpolation in call to trigrid
00029 ;   regular = If set, do not call trigrid -- x0 and y0 must be linear.
00030 ;   cubic   = If set, use cubic convolution
00031 ;   extrapolate = If set, then extrapolate beyond boundary points
00032 ;   bin = set to bin data prior to interpolation.
00033 ;         (e.g. bin=2 interpolate every second pixel)
00034 ; Returned:
00035 ;   result = a vector N_elements(X1) long 
00036 ;      or, if /grid is set
00037 ;   result = an array that is N_elements(X1) by N_elements(Y1)
00038 ;
00039 ; PROCEDURE:
00040 ;   First call the IDL intrinsic routines TRIANGULATE & TRIGRID to make
00041 ;   sure that X0 and Y0 are linear (if /regular is not set).
00042 ;   Then call the IDL intrinsic INTERPOLATE to do bilinear interpolation.
00043 ; RESTRICTIONS:
00044 ;   X0 and Y0 must be linear functions.
00045 ;   A must be a 2-d array
00046 ; HISTORY:
00047 ;    9-mar-94, J. R. Lemen LPARL, Written.
00048 ;   20-Jan-95, JRL, Added the REGULAR & CUBIC keywords
00049 ;   6-Sept-97, Zarro, GSFC, allowed for 2-d (X-Y) coordinate inputs
00050 ;  22-Apri-99, Zarro, SM&A/GSFC - added /triangulate and made /regular
00051 ;              the default (much faster).
00052 ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 function exist,var
00054 
00055 return,n_elements(var) ne 0
00056 
00057 end
00058 ;
00059 ;
00060 ; Project     : SOHO - CDS
00061 ;
00062 ; Name        : WHERE_VECTOR
00063 ;
00064 ; Purpose     : WHERE function for vectors
00065 ;
00066 ; Category    : Utility
00067 ;
00068 ; Explanation :
00069 ;
00070 ; Syntax      : IDL> ok=where_vector(vector,array,count)
00071 ;
00072 ; Inputs      : VECTOR = vector with with search elements
00073 ;               ARRAY = array to search for each element
00074 ;
00075 ; Opt. Inputs : None
00076 ;
00077 ; Outputs     : OK = subscripts of elements in ARRAY that match elements in vector
00078 
00079 ; Opt. Outputs: COUNT = total # of matches found
00080 ;
00081 ; Keywords    : TRIM = trim inputs if string inputs
00082 ;               CASE = make case sensitive if string inputs 
00083 ;               REST = indicies in ARRAY that don't match VECTOR
00084 ;               RCOUNT = # of non-matching elements
00085 ;               NOSORT = skip sorting input search vector
00086 ;
00087 ; Common      : None
00088 ;
00089 ; Restrictions: None
00090 ;
00091 ; Side effects: None
00092 ;
00093 ; History     : Version 1,  25-Dec-1995,  D.M. Zarro.  Written
00094 
00095 function where_vector,vector,array,count,nosort=nosort,$
00096        trim_string=trim_string,case_sens=case_sens,rest=rest,rcount=rcount
00097 
00098 if not exist(vector) or not exist(array) then return,-1
00099 count=0
00100 np=n_elements(array)
00101 rcount=np
00102 rest=lindgen(np)
00103 
00104 ;-- protect inputs and modify
00105 
00106 trim_string=keyword_set(trim_string)
00107 case_sens=keyword_set(case_sens)
00108 
00109 svec=vector & sarr=array
00110 
00111 if not keyword_set(nosort) then begin
00112  rs=uniq([svec],sort([svec]))
00113  svec=svec(rs) 
00114 endif
00115 
00116 if datatype(vector) eq 'STR' then begin
00117  if trim_string then svec=strtrim(svec,2)
00118  if not case_sens then svec=strupcase(svec)
00119 endif
00120 if datatype(array) eq 'STR' then begin
00121  if trim_string then sarr=strtrim(sarr,2)
00122  if not case_sens then sarr=strupcase(sarr)
00123 endif
00124 
00125 state=''
00126 nvecs=n_elements(svec)
00127 pieces=strarr(nvecs)
00128 v=svec & s=sarr
00129 for i=0,nvecs-1 do begin
00130  index=strtrim(string(i),2)
00131  pieces(i)='(v('+index+') eq s)'
00132  if i eq 0 then pieces(i)='clook=where('+pieces(i)
00133  if i eq (nvecs-1) then pieces(i)=pieces(i)+',count)'
00134  if (nvecs eq 1) or (i eq 0) then conn='' else conn=' or '
00135  state=state+conn+pieces(i)
00136 endfor
00137 
00138 status=execute(strcompress(strtrim(state,2)))
00139 
00140 if count gt 0 then begin
00141  rest(clook)=-1
00142  rlook=where(rest gt -1,rcount)
00143  if rcount gt 0 then rest=rest(rlook) else rest=-1
00144 endif
00145 
00146 return,clook & end
00147 
00148 
00149  function interp2d, A, x0, y0, x1, y1, nxny, missing=missing,   $
00150     grid=grid, quintic=quintic, regular=regular, cubic=cubic,$
00151         extrapolate=extrapolate,bin=bin,trigrid=trigrid
00152 
00153 ;-- Check for self-consistent input dimensions
00154 
00155 sz = size(a)
00156 
00157 if sz(0) ne 2 then begin
00158   message,'input data array must be 2-D',/cont
00159   return,-1
00160 endif
00161 
00162 sx=size(x0) & sy=size(y0)
00163 chk=where_vector(sx,sy,count)
00164 if count eq 0 then begin
00165  message,'input X-Y coordinate arrays do not match in size',/cont
00166  return,-1
00167 endif
00168 
00169 twod=0
00170 case 1 of
00171  sx(0) eq 1: begin
00172   nx=sx(1) & ny=sy(1)
00173  end
00174  sx(0) eq 2: begin
00175   twod=1
00176   nx=sx(1) & ny=sx(2)
00177  end
00178  else: begin
00179   message,'input X-Y coordinate arrays must 1- or 2-D',/cont
00180   return,-1
00181  end
00182 endcase
00183  
00184 if (sz(1) ne nx) or (sz(2) ne ny) then begin
00185  message,'Dimensions of Data, X0, Y0 are not consistent',/cont
00186  return,-1
00187 endif
00188 
00189 ;-- Call triangulate and trigrid to get a regularly spaced grid
00190 
00191 if exist(regular) then regular = (0 > regular < 1) else $
00192  if keyword_set(trigrid) then regular=0 else regular=1
00193 
00194 if not keyword_set(regular) then begin
00195   message,'using trigrid option...',/cont
00196   if n_elements(nxny) eq 0 then nxny = [nx,ny]
00197 
00198   print,'% nx,ny: ',nxny(0),nxny(1)
00199 
00200   gs = [(max(X0)-min(X0))/(nxny(0)-1), (max(Y0)-min(Y0))/(nxny(1)-1)]
00201 
00202   if not twod then begin
00203    x0 = reform(temporary(x0),nx,ny)
00204    y0 = transpose(reform(temporary(y0),nx,ny))
00205   endif 
00206 
00207   triangulate, x0, y0, tr,bound
00208 
00209   if n_elements(quintic) eq 0 then quintic = 0  ; Make sure quintic is defined
00210 
00211   if keyword_set(extrapolate) then begin
00212    zz = trigrid(x0,y0, A, tr, gs, quintic=quintic,$
00213                 extrapolate=bound)
00214   endif else begin
00215    zz = trigrid(x0,y0, A, tr, gs, quintic=quintic)
00216   endelse
00217 
00218   if not twod then begin
00219    x0=reform(temporary(x0),nx*ny)
00220    y0=reform(transpose(temporary(y0)),nx*ny)
00221   endif
00222 
00223   zz = temporary(zz(0:nxny(0)-1,0:nxny(1)-1))   ; Make sure the dimensions are matched
00224 endif else zz = A           ; /regular was set -- x0 and y0 are linear
00225 
00226 sz = size(zz)
00227 xslope = (max(X0)-min(X0)) / (sz(1)-1)
00228 yslope = (max(Y0)-min(Y0)) / (sz(2)-1)
00229 
00230 
00231 ; Map the coordinates
00232 
00233 x2 = (x1 - min(x0)) / xslope
00234 y2 = (y1 - min(y0)) / yslope
00235 
00236 ; Now interpolate
00237 
00238 if n_elements(grid)    eq 0 then grid = 0
00239 if n_elements(cubic)   eq 0 then cubic= 0
00240 if n_elements(missing) eq 0 then $
00241         return,interpolate(zz,x2,y2,grid=grid,cubic=cubic) else $
00242         return,interpolate(zz,x2,y2,grid=grid,missing=missing,cubic=cubic)
00243 end
